physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hypotensive on arrival at the hospital.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially hypotenisive, no further changes specified.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increased pain and deformity at nine months postoperatively.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressed to femoral nonunion, varus collapse, and implant failure at nine months.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No symptoms reported during follow-up six months postoperatively, but 5° varus deformity noted on radiographs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported no symptoms but had evidence of varus deformity at six months.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild knee stiffness and swelling with occasional pain reported at eighteen weeks postoperatively.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms persisted but were manageable and did not require medication.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild pain and stiffness in the knee reported at six months postoperatively, with 5° varus collapse noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported decrease in pain over ten months with additional healing, and using a cane for walking at final follow-up.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild activity-related pain and swelling noted at seven months postoperatively.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Radiographs showed varus collapse and backing screws, leading to revision surgery.
